definition: to control/to accuse/to charge/to sue/to invert a container to empty it/(suffix) (slang) buff/enthusiast/devotee/-phile or -philia
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: The nurses denied the charges and said they had been tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: The people were charged with mortgage-related misrepresentations and other criminal abuses. The F. B.
sentences.chinese: 这些人被控告抵押相关的欺诈和其它犯罪性质的滥用。

sentences.english: Mr Walendowski said he would tell police "the truth, " according to the complaint.
sentences.chinese: 根据控告书，沃伦斗斯基先生说他愿意告知警察实情。

sentences.english: Now he accused Victor of adultery .
sentences.chinese: 现在他以通奸罪控告维克多。

sentences.english: Then wait Alexeyevich Prague will be charged with the crime of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 接下来等待布拉格耶维奇，将是贪污罪的控告。

sentences.english: I mustered up enough courage to accuse him.
sentences.chinese: 我鼓起足够的勇气控告他。

sentences.english: He failed to establish his charge.
The nurses denied the charges and said they were tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: He is chargeable with a fault or neglect.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因过失或疏忽而被控告。

sentences.english: A cause of action has  accrued when the right to sue has become vested.
sentences.chinese: 起诉的理由在控告权被赋予后随之存在。

sentences.english: Fan said he had not ruled out suing the authorities over the decision.
sentences.chinese: 范说他并不排除控告官方做出这个决定的可能。

sentences.english: I can sue you for slander.
sentences.chinese: 我可以控告你进行诬陷。

sentences.english: Ingrid said that she would file a complaint.
sentences.chinese: 英格丽德说她将提出控告。

sentences.english: The prosecutor accused the defendant of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 原告控告被告犯有欺诈罪。

sentences.english: Both Mr. Chirac and Mr. Villepin say they will file complaints against Bourgi.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克和德维勒班都表示，他们将对布吉提出控告。

definition: to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to sue/to take to court/to file a lawsuit
to report (an offense to the authorities)/to inform against sb
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to file a complaint/to appeal (to an authority, a higher court of justice etc)/complaint/appeal
